0.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>The <break time='200ms'/> villagers <break time='200ms'/> were <break time='200ms'/> very <break time='200ms'/> angry. <break time='200ms'/></prosody></speak>

1.text: The boy played the trick many days. One day a wolf really came. The boy cried for help. This time nobody came to help him. The wolf killed all the sheep. The boy never lied again.
1.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>The <break time='200ms'/> boy <break time='200ms'/> played <break time='200ms'/> the <break time='200ms'/> trick <break time='200ms'/> many <break time='200ms'/> days. <break time='200ms'/> One <break time='200ms'/> day <break time='200ms'/> a <break time='200ms'/> wolf <break time='200ms'/> really <break time='200ms'/> came. <break time='200ms'/> The <break time='200ms'/> boy <break time='200ms'/> cried <break time='200ms'/> for <break time='200ms'/> help. <break time='200ms'/> This <break time='200ms'/> time <break time='200ms'/> nobody <break time='200ms'/> came <break time='200ms'/> to <break time='200ms'/> help <break time='200ms'/> him. <break time='200ms'/> The <break time='200ms'/> wolf <break time='200ms'/> killed <break time='200ms'/> all <break time='200ms'/> the <break time='200ms'/> sheep. <break time='200ms'/> The <break time='200ms'/> boy <break time='200ms'/> never <break time='200ms'/> lied <break time='200ms'/> again. <break time='200ms'/></prosody></speak>

2.text: Read the story aloud. Ask the following questions. • Who looked after the sheep? • Where did he take the sheep? • Who were angry? Why? • Did the villagers come in when the wolf had come? • What did the wolf do in the end? Get the students to act out the story.
